results.title: The Supervisor as a leader. Part 1
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Caravel Films and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in supervision”
Several workmen are asked what they consider to be the attributes of a good supervisor. The four most important qualities are: always keep promises, never take credit for someone else’s work, don’t pass the buck and don’t play favourites
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, Caravel Films and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids

results.title: Sunshine North Technical School (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place Where Books Are Kept”
Examines new techniques and attitudes toward the total library services in a co-educational technical school in Victoria (Sunshine North Technical School) with a large migrant student population.

results.title: Sunset country
results.creator_credit: David Corke and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: A record of an expedition of 12 people who crossed a little-known area of the Victorian Mallee known as the Sunset Country to find out more about the wild life that lives there. Members of the party included C. Austin, R. Boswell, D.G. Corke, D. Holland, M.A. Howard, F.E. Lobb, A.R. McEvey, E. Molesworth, G.M. Pizzey, H.M. Ross, H.N.B. Wettenhall. Commentary by Graham Lynden.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Corke and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.description: A record of an expedition of 12 people who crossed a little-known area of the Victorian Mallee known as the Sunset Country to find out more about the wild life that lives there. Commentary by Graham Lynden.

results.title: The Sun is our star
results.brief_description: The sun is the Earth’s source of energy and life. Describes the nature of the sun’s rays - ultra violet, infra red, heat and radio waves. Discusses solar spots, solar eclipses, and the polar aurora, their causes and effects such as electrical storms and radio disturbances.

results.title: The Summer game
results.brief_description: Traces the history of cricket from its origin as a two stump game played by yokels on the village green, through its phase as a betting sport after the Restoration, to the modern counterpart played by professionals.

results.title: The Summer before
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Peter Llewellin and Crawley Films
results.brief_description: Shows high performance athletes and Canadian teams preparing for the 1976 Olympic Games at Montreal. Formation, drive, competition, and personal disappointment are the subjects tackled in this film.

results.title: Succession on lava
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”
Illustrates the destruction caused by a volcanic eruption in Hawaii, and examines the difficulties encountered by the first forms of life that re-appear. Traces the stages of ecological succession, from the blue-green algae to the re-establishment of a mature biotic community.

results.title: Succession from sand dune to forest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Explains that succession is the process by which a given area changes slowly and continuously until it finally becomes a stable community. Shows one of the earliest and most thoroughly studied examples of this process on the shore of Lake Michigan

results.title: Successful scholarship
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology for Living”
Assists students in developing sound study methods by depicting techniques worked out by a student of nursing who has adapted hospital routines to the forming of study habits based on three concepts: systematic planning, a suitable place for study and concentration, a definite method for assimilating the content of each assignment.

results.title: The Stuff we throw away
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley and Stuart Finley Productions
results.brief_description: Relates how innovative demonstration grants and research activities being developed by the Bureau of Solid Waste Management in association with local communities can develop new and better systems for solid waste disposal. Methods include a pollution free incinerator, and “Mount Trashmore” built of above-grade sanitary landfill.
